page.title: 02TRAMWAY MUSEUM
page.content: This museum is situated in part of a derelict limestone quarry originally opened by George Stephenson.The tramway is laid on part of the track bed of the old narrow gauge mineral railway. At the museum there are about 50 tramcars from Britain and abroad _horsedrawn,steam and electric.A town street has been reconstructed with the tram running through. In one year up to 106,000 people visit the museum, and the most popular tram is the LCC 106. Once a year a Transport Extravaganza is held when as many as 30,000 people come.This is held at the August Bank Holiday weekend.There are many other special events held there _such as a Teddy Bear's outing.
